intro: Calonemorchis phaeoclavia, commonly known as the purple-stemmed orchid, is a rare and specialized orchid species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring dark purple stems and lance-shaped leaves with a waxy surface. The plant produces small, delicate flowers in shades of white and purple, typically blooming during the wet season. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires specific soil conditions for successful growth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
